Ajax Example

MySQL as a relational database is great at giving any website back-end functionality. This means that users of your website can submit information, and your website will be able to store and manipulate that information to do what you need it to. This example is particularly interesting because it will show the ability to submit and then retrieve what you've submitted instantaneously through the use of MySQL and Ajax.

Start off by submitting some product names to work with

After you have submitted some product names, start typing in the following box and see what happens!

Isn't that crazy awesome???
